title: NBA Live Analytics Meta-Experiment
description: A Vox-style explainer video about the NBA Live Analytics experiment - a meta-experiment testing spec-driven development through real-time basketball analytics.

props.hook: What if you could validate a development methodology through live sports data?
props.subtitle: NBA Live Analytics Meta-Experiment

scenes.narration: What if you could validate a development methodology through live sports data?

props.hook: Hypothesis: Spec-driven development produces both working software AND methodology documentation.
props.subtitle: The Dual Artifact

scenes.narration: The hypothesis: spec-driven development can produce both working software and actionable methodology insights simultaneously.

concepts.name: Duo Synergy
concepts.description: Two-player combinations and points per possession

scenes.narration: The dashboard offers three analytical lenses: Duo Synergy for two-player efficiency, Defensive Impact for matchup analysis, and Shot Network for visualizing shot creation flows.
The infrastructure includes a Cloudflare Worker proxy with rate limiting, D1 database for player baselines and game archives, and real-time polling for live updates.

props.title: Data Captured in the Database
props.insight: Comprehensive basketball analytics stored in Cloudflare D1

scenes.narration: The database captures DARKO-compatible player baselines, season averages, play-by-play archives, box scores, and daily game snapshots.

props.title: Player Baseline Metrics
props.insight: Per-100 possession metrics enable "vs expected" analysis

scenes.narration: Player baselines include offensive and defensive ratings, usage rates, and true shooting percentages enabling versus-expected performance analysis.
The development journey: spec creation on January 4th, infrastructure built January 5th, database enhancements on the 8th, and now a live real-time analytics dashboard.

props.hook: Ball movement correlates with scoring: +15.8 points per game when assist rate increases.
props.subtitle: Data-Driven Insight

scenes.narration: A key insight from the data: ball movement strongly correlates with scoring efficiency, with teams seeing plus 15.8 points per game when assist rates increase.
The comparison: traditional ad-hoc development with unclear criteria versus spec-driven development with YAML specs guiding agent-based work.
